Prompt:
def is_equal_to_sum_even(n: int) -> bool:
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(4)
    False
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(6)
    False
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(8)
    True
    """
Completions:
def is_equal_to_sum_even(n: int) -> bool:
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(4)
    False
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(6)
    False
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(8)
    True
    """
    if n % 2 == 0:
        return False
    return sum([n // 2 for n in range(1, n // 2 + 1)]) == n

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n: int) -> bool:
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(4)
    False
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(6)
    False
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(8)
    True
    """
    if n % 2 == 0:
        return True
    return False

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n: int) -> bool:
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(4)
    False
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(6)
    False
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(8)
    True
    """
    if n < 1:
        return False
    if n == 1:
        return True
    if n % 2 == 0:
        return False
    return is_equal_to_sum_even(n - 2) and is_equal_to_sum_even(n - 4) and is_equal_to_sum_even(n - 6)

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n: int) -> bool:
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(4)
    False
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(6)
    False
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(8)
    True
    """
    return n in (n - 2, n - 4, n - 6, n - 8)

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n: int) -> bool:
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(4)
    False
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(6)
    False
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(8)
    True
    """
    if n % 2 == 0:
        return False
    return sum([n // 2, 2 * n // 2, 4 * n // 2, 6 * n // 2]) == n

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n: int) -> bool:
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(4)
    False
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(6)
    False
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(8)
    True
    """
    if n < 0:
        return False
    if n == 0:
        return True
    if n % 2 == 0:
        return False
    return sum([int(n / 2) for _ in range(4)]) == n

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n: int) -> bool:
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(4)
    False
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(6)
    False
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(8)
    True
    """
    if n < 0:
        return False
    if n == 0:
        return True
    if n % 2 == 0:
        return False
    return is_equal_to_sum_even(n - 2) and is_equal_to_sum_even(n - 4) and is_equal_to_sum_even(n - 6) and is_equal_to_sum_even(n - 8)

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n: int) -> bool:
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(4)
    False
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(6)
    False
    >>> is_equal_to_sum_even(8)
    True
    """
    if n == 0:
        return False
    if n % 2 == 0:
        return True
    return False
Tests:
def check(candidate):
    assert candidate(4) == False
    assert candidate(6) == False
    assert candidate(8) == True
    assert candidate(10) == True
    assert candidate(11) == False
    assert candidate(12) == True
    assert candidate(13) == False
    assert candidate(16) == True

def test_check():
    check(is_equal_to_sum_even)

test_check()
